summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about proximity! Pastor Scott Williams delivers an incredible sermon that challenges us to get closer to Jesus by being in the right proximity - to people, places, and things. Drawing from the story in Mark 2 about the paralyzed man, Scott shares how four friends' determination to get their friend to Jesus can teach us powerful life lessons. He emphasizes that who you surround yourself with matters tremendously, using a powerful personal story about an inmate named Lou who transformed his life by changing his circle. The sermon isn't just a message, it's a call to action - to dig through obstacles, to keep pursuing Jesus, and to position yourself strategically for breakthrough. Scott's personal experiences, from being a prison warden to his work on the pardon and parole board, provide raw, authentic insights into how proximity can change everything. The most powerful moment? When he challenges everyone to get close to the 'things of Jesus' - serving, giving, and pursuing God with intentionality. This message is a game-changer for anyone feeling stuck or wanting to see real transformation in their life.
mainPoints: Proximity to the right people matters
Positioning yourself in the right places is crucial
Pursue the things of Jesus with intentionality

versesMentioned.text: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home. They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them. Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them. Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on.

Monday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Monday.focus: Evaluating your current circle of influence
Monday.action: List the top 5 people you spend the most time with. Reflect on how they influence your spiritual growth, goals, and character. Are they helping or hindering your walk with God?
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me recognize the influence of those around me. Give me wisdom to cultivate relationships that draw me closer to You and Your purpose. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Hebrews 10:25: 'Not giving up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging one another—and all the more as you see the Day approaching.'
Tuesday.action: Research and commit to joining a small group or church community. If already in one, reach out to someone in your group and offer genuine encouragement.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, help me value Christian community. Show me how to be both a support and supported in my spiritual journey. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you need to 'dig through the roof' - what obstacle are you avoiding that requires persistent effort?
Wednesday.prayer: God, give me the courage to persist, to dig through obstacles, and to stay focused on Your calling. Help me not give up. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Psalm 1:1-3: 'Blessed is the one who does not walk in step with the wicked or stand in the way that sinners take or sit in the company of mockers, but whose delight is in the law of the Lord.'
Thursday.action: Audit your media consumption, social media follows, and entertainment choices. Remove influences that don't align with spiritual growth.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me create an environment that nurtures my faith. Guide me to influences that draw me closer to You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Proverbs 27:17: 'As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.'
Friday.action: Reach out to a spiritually mature friend or mentor. Ask for honest feedback about your spiritual growth and areas needing improvement.
Friday.prayer: God, surround me with people who will challenge me to grow, who will speak truth in love, and who will help me become more like Jesus. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Matthew 6:33: 'But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.'
Saturday.action: Spend dedicated time in prayer and reflection. Ask God to reveal any areas where you're not positioning yourself close to His purposes.
Saturday.prayer: Father, realign my heart with Your purposes. Show me how to prioritize Your kingdom in every area of my life. Make me sensitive to Your leading. Amen.
